text: HR <74fty TTHT wifalqrr"t {HIT / Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (9+ 9Raat #ir <HTf #FT4) 444 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India VR: /Extn = 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 0i1-5 &af 6, Arer-10, EOT; #f frft _ 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No.11041/218/2007-Admn: 25th 2011 POLICY MATTER Technical (77/2011) (Decision taken in Legal Division File NoNHAIIDR&A CellARB (Misc)2010) Sub: Procedure for referring the decision of DRB to Arbitration The Executive Committee in its meeting held on 28.03.2011 has framed time schedule for deciding the DRB recommendation on its acceptance Or challenge, which has been determined after considering a total of 56 period. 2 . In all old contracts where provision of DRBIDRE exists, time provided for issuing notice of intention to commence Arbitration on the recommendation of DRB's is 28 days from the date of receipt of recommendation by the parties Though BKC Committee has suggested to increase the time limit of 28 days to 60 days but for contracts already finalized where disputes are pending, we may have to consider the time frame of 28 days only: In such cases, it has been decided with the approval of Competent Authority to follow the time schedule given below: a) Project Director of PIU Must file his report within one week of the DRB Award, b) CGM & RO concerned Must file his reportlrecommendation within 3 days of the receipt of PD's report: c) Concerned   Technical Division at HQ Must   file their  recommendation within one week of the receipt of the report of the Regional Office: d) Three Member's Committee Must give their opinion within one keek.
